briefdescription.para: Number of momenta instantiated for the model (10). With 5 maximum external legs, this is fairly safe.
Default space-time for the model's particles. There is actually no support for another space that csl::Minkowski yet.
Lagrangian of the model.

detaileddescription.para: The lagrangian is modified only through built-in functions, either from this class (ModelData) for basic content modifications, or from the ModelBuilder class for more complicated model building features (symmetry breaking, replacements etc).

briefdescription.para: Space time for the model.

detaileddescription.para: By default, this variable is a pointer to csl::Minkowski (4D). There is actually no support for another space time so for now, nothing to do with this member.

briefdescription.para: Gauge of the model.
Flavor of the model.
Particle content (including gauge bosons, ghosts etc) of the model.

simplesect.para: getParticle(), addParticle()

briefdescription.para: Lists of scalar couplings of the model.

simplesect.para: getScalarCouplings(), getScalarCoupling(), addScalarCoupling()

briefdescription.para: List of tensor couplings of the model.

simplesect.para: getTensorCouplings(), getTensorCoupling(), addTensorCoupling()

briefdescription.para: Boolean that tells if the gauge model is initilialized.

detaileddescription.para: When building a model, the gauge must be created first before adding any other particle. The gauge must be fixed by calling the init() function. Only then, particles can be added using addParticle() function.

simplesect.para: init(), setGauge(), addGaugedGroup(), ModelData()

briefdescription.para: Boolean telling if checks must be done with lagrangian terms added to the model (gauge representation, dispatching ...)

simplesect.para: addLagrangianTerm(), isEnableChecks(), setEnableCheck()

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Instantiates a null flavor, and an empty gauge. This is a valid state and you can add gauge groups through addGaugedGroup().

briefdescription.para: Constructor with one parameter.
Constructor with 2 parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Gauge now owned by the Model.
Flavor now owned by the Model.

briefdescription.para: Constructor with 3 parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Gauge now owned by the Model.
Flavor now owned by the Model.
Particles to add to the Model after intializing the gauge and flavor.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Defaulted move constructor.
Defaulted move assignement operator.
Defaulted copy constructor.
Defaulted copy assignement operator.

Initializes the gauge once and for all. This function must be called after finishing the gauge, and before adding matter particles. Calling the constructors that take an already built gauge, this function is called automatically. Otherwise you have to call it.

parameterdescription.para: Boolean (default = true) that tells if kinetic and mass terms for gauge bosons and ghosts must be added.

briefdescription.para: Checks the hermiticity of the Lagrangian, i.e. checks if $ \mathcal{L}^\dagger = \mathcal{L} $.

detaileddescription.para: If the Lagrangian is not hermitian, this function simply prints out the problematic terms. There is no check for integration by parts, so the Lagrangian may still be hermitic, this function simply does not automatically recognize this kind of patterns.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const reference to the Lagrangian.

detaileddescription.para:
The lagrangian should not be modified directly. Always prefer using buitl-in functions to modify it. This is why this function returns an const-reference. The way to get the lagrangian from it is mty::Lagrangianconst&L=model.getLagrangian();
The lagrangian of the model.

briefdescription.para: Sets enableChecks.

parameterdescription.para: New boolean value

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the space time of the mode (csl::Space).

detaileddescription.para:
For now, only csl::Minkowski is supported.
The space-time of the model.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the model's gauge.

detaileddescription.para:
This function does not transfer the ownership. In particular, you have not to delete the data.
The gauge of the model.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the model's flavor.

detaileddescription.para:
This function does not transfer the ownership. In particular, you have not to delete the data.
The flavor of the model.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const reference to the model's particles.

detaileddescription.para:
Particles should be modified through the built-in functions, not directly from this vector. This is why the function only returns a const reference. It must be called as follows std::vector<mty::Particle>const&particles=model.getParticles();
The particles of the model.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of the physical particles in a model.

simplesect.para: The list of physical particles.

briefdescription.para: Returns the scalar couplings (gauge coupling typically) of the model.

detaileddescription.para:
When a gauge group is created, a gauge coupling constant comes with it. This coupling is stored in the model's scalar couplings that you can get with this function (as a constant reference).
The list of scalar couplings of the theory.

briefdescription.para: Returns the tensor couplings (Yukawa coupling typically) of the model.

detaileddescription.para:
When a Yukawa coupling is created, th corresponding tensor is stored in the model's tensor couplings that you can get with this function (as a constant reference).
The list of tensor couplings of the theory.

briefdescription.para: Sets the space time of the model.

simplesect.para: This function as been written to possibly extend MARTY to other space-time calculations than 4D Minkowski but it does not support it yet. This function should then not be used.

parameterdescription.para: New space time for the model.

briefdescription.para: Sets the gauge of the model.

memberdef.argsstring: (group::Type type, std::string_view name, int dim, csl::Expr const &coupling=nullptr)
memberdef.name: addGaugedGroup

briefdescription.para: Adds a gauge group to the model.

detaileddescription.para:
This function allow to add a gauged group to the model, before initializing it (see init()) and adding matter particles. Given the type, the name, the dimension and (optionnaly) a coupling constant, the corresponding group, gauge boson, ghosts are created.
After adding all desired gauged groups, you must call the init() function that settels once and for all the gauge.
If not given, the particles and couplings names follow the group name: A_<name> for the gauge bosons, c_<name> for the ghosts, g_<name> for the coupling constant.
type
Type of the gauged group
name
Name of the group
dim
Dimension of the group (3 for SU(3) etc)
coupling
Coupling constant (optional)
GaugedGroup, Gauge

briefdescription.para: Adds a gauge group to the model.

detaileddescription.para: This function allow to add a gauged group to the model, before initializing it (see init()) and adding matter particles. Given the type, the name, and (optionnaly) a coupling constant, the corresponding group, gauge boson, ghosts are created. Here the dimension is not given. This function must then be used only for U(1), and exceptional algebras.

simplesect.para: After adding all desired gauged groups, you must call the init() function that settels once and for all the gauge.
If not given, the particles and couplings names follow the group name: A_<name> for the gauge bosons, c_<name> for the ghosts, g_<name> for the coupling constant.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the gauged group
Name of the group
Coupling constant (optional)

simplesect.para: GaugedGroup, Gauge

briefdescription.para: Adds a flavor group to the model.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the flavor group
Number of flavors

simplesect.para: FlavorGroup, Flavor

briefdescription.para: Adds a flavor group to the model.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the flavor group
Number of flavors (keep the dimension symbolic)

simplesect.para: FlavorGroup, Flavor

briefdescription.para: Sets the flavor of the model.
Adds a particle to the model.

detaileddescription.para: When adding a particle, its gauge representation should be already set, and the model must be initialized (see init()). You can choose to let MARTY create kinetic (including covariant derivative) and mass terms (default) or disable all automatic interaction terms with the initializeTerms parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Particle to add to the model
Boolean (default = true) that tells if kinetic and mass terms must be added automatically.

briefdescription.para: Adds a list of particles to the model.

detaileddescription.para: When adding a particle, its gauge representation should be already set, and the model must be initialized (see init()). You can choose to let MARTY create kinetic (including covariant derivative) and mass terms (default) or disable all automatic interaction terms with the initializeTerms parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Particles to add to the model
Boolean (default = true) that tells if kinetic and mass terms must be added automatically.

briefdescription.para: Removes a particle from the model.

detaileddescription.para: When removing a particle, all interaction terms containing it are removed. It is a non-return point. If you simply want to disable a given particle in calculations, consider using mty::DisableParticle().

parameterdescription.para: Particle to remove.

simplesect.para: addParticle(), mty::DisableParticle()

briefdescription.para: Removes particles from the model.

detaileddescription.para: When removing a particle, all interaction terms containing it are removed. It is a non-return point. If you simply want to disable a given particle in calculations, consider using mty::DisableParticle().

parameterdescription.para: Particles to remove.

simplesect.para: addParticle(), mty::DisableParticle()

briefdescription.para: Removes a particle from the model.

detaileddescription.para: When removing a particle, all interaction terms containing it are removed. It is a non-return point. If you simply want to disable a given particle in calculations, consider using mty::DisableParticle().

parameterdescription.para: Name of the particle to remove.

simplesect.para: addParticle(), mty::DisableParticle()

briefdescription.para: Removes particles from the model.

detaileddescription.para: When removing a particle, all interaction terms containing it are removed. It is a non-return point. If you simply want to disable a given particle in calculations, consider using mty::DisableParticle().

parameterdescription.para: Names of the particles to remove.

simplesect.para: addParticle(), mty::DisableParticle()

briefdescription.para: Checks the validity of a particle when adding it to the model.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks if the gauge, flavor of the particle are the same as the ones defined in the model. If the particle is not valid, an error message is printed and the program stops.

parameterdescription.para: Particle to check

briefdescription.para: Checks the validity of a term when adding it to the Lagrangian.

detaileddescription.para: This function simply computes the tensor product of the gauge representations of all particles in the interaction (taking conjugate representations for conjugate fields) and checks that the trivial gauge representation exists in the resulting decomposition. This represents a quick check of gauge invariance, even though the exact gauge invariance is not guaranteed at this point.

parameterdescription.para: Term to check

briefdescription.para: Adds a lagrangian term to the model.

detaileddescription.para: The term can be a kinetic, mass term, or interaction term. It must be of course gauge invariant (see checkValidity()), and have no free indices (scalar term). Setting addHermitic to true, to hermitian conjugate will be computed and added automatically. For example, you may have in a Lagrangian \[ \mathcal{L}\ni \frac{g}{\sqrt{2}} \bar{u}W^+\cdot \gamma P_Ld + h.c, \] (in that case the '+h.c' corresponds to addHermitic = true), or \[ \mathcal{L} \ni \frac{2}{3}e\bar{u}A\cdot \gamma u, \] that do not have an hermitian counter part.

parameterdescription.para: Lagrangian term to add
Boolean (default = false) that tells if the hermitian conjugate of the term must be also added

briefdescription.para: Adds a lagrangian term to the model.

detaileddescription.para: The term can be a kinetic, mass term, or interaction term. It must be of course gauge invariant (see checkValidity()), and have no free indices (scalar term). Setting addHermitic to true, to hermitian conjugate will be computed and added automatically. For example, you may have in a Lagrangian \[ \mathcal{L}\ni \frac{g}{\sqrt{2}} \bar{u}W^+\cdot \gamma P_Ld + h.c, \] (in that case the '+h.c' corresponds to addHermitic = true), or \[ \mathcal{L} \ni \frac{2}{3}e\bar{u}A\cdot \gamma u, \] that do not have an hermitian counter part.

parameterdescription.para: Lagrangian term to add
Boolean (default = false) that tells if the hermitian conjugate of the term must be also added

briefdescription.para: Adds a bosonic mass term to the model.

detaileddescription.para: A bosonic mass term for a field $ \phi $ of mass $ m $ is of the form \[ \mathcal{L}_M \ni \pm \eta m^2 \phi ^\dagger \phi \], with $ \eta = 1/2 $ if $ \phi ^\dagger = \phi$, $ \eta = 1 $ otherwise. For spin 1 particles, the sign is positive, and negative for spin 0 particles.

parameterdescription.para: mty::Particle or any valid type for the getParticle() function.
Field in the mass term (must be bosonic).
Name of the mass to add.

briefdescription.para: Adds a bosonic mass term to the model.

detaileddescription.para: A bosonic mass term for a field $ \phi $ of mass $ m $ is of the form \[ \mathcal{L}_M \ni \pm \eta m^2 \phi ^\dagger \phi \], with $ \eta = 1/2 $ if $ \phi ^\dagger = \phi$, $ \eta = 1 $ otherwise. For spin 1 particles, the sign is positive, and negative for spin 0 particles. After the function call, the mass of the boson is set to the given mass $ m $, and any other mass term with $$\phi$$ is suppressed.

parameterdescription.para: mty::Particle or any valid type for the getParticle() function.
Field in the mass term (must be bosonic).
Mass to add (must be scalar).

briefdescription.para: Adds a fermionic mass to the model.

detaileddescription.para: This function adds a Weyl mass term for left and right. Considering two Weyl fermions $ \psi _L $ and $ \psi _R $, the mass term reads \[ m\left(\psi _L^\dagger \psi _R + \psi _R^\dagger \psi _L\right). \] After the function call, the mass of the two weyl fermions is set to the given mass $ m $, and any other mass term with $ \psi_ L $ or $ \psi _R $ is suppressed.

parameterdescription.para: mty::Particle or any valid type for the getParticle() function.
mty::Particle or any valid type for the getParticle() function.
Left-handed Weyl fermion.
Right-handed Weyl fermion.
Name of the mass for the fermion.

briefdescription.para: Adds a fermionic mass to the model.

detaileddescription.para: This function adds a Weyl mass term for left and right. Considering two Weyl fermions $ \psi _L $ and $ \psi _R $, the mass term reads \[ m\left(\psi _L^\dagger \psi _R + \psi _R^\dagger \psi _L\right). \] After the function call, the mass of the two weyl fermions is set to the given mass $ m $, and any other mass term with $ \psi_ L $ or $ \psi _R $ is suppressed.

parameterdescription.para: mty::Particle or any valid type for the getParticle() function.
mty::Particle or any valid type for the getParticle() function.
Left-handed Weyl fermion.
Right-handed Weyl fermion.
Mass for the fermion.

briefdescription.para: Adds a fermionic mass to the model.

detaileddescription.para: This function adds a simple fermionic mass term for a particle, actually similar to a bosonic mass term replacing $ \phi ^* $ by $\bar{\psi}$. See addBosonicMass() for more details.

parameterdescription.para: mty::Particle or any valid type for the getParticle() function.
Dirac fermion.
Name of the mass for the fermion.

briefdescription.para: Adds a fermionic mass to the model.

detaileddescription.para: This function adds a simple fermionic mass term for a particle, actually similar to a bosonic mass term replacing $ \phi ^\dagger $ by $\bar{\psi}$. See addBosonicMass() for more details.

parameterdescription.para: mty::Particle or any valid type for the getParticle() function.
Dirac fermion.
Mass for the fermion.

briefdescription.para: Actually renames a particle.

parameterdescription.para: Particle to rename.
New name for the particle.

briefdescription.para: The class ModelData contains all the necessary features to store and manipulate the content of a model. No model building (symmetry breaking, replacements etc) or computation are implemented in it.

detaileddescription.para:
This class contains the Lagrangian of the theory (all interaction, kinetic, and mass terms), the gauge, flavor symmetries, particles, quantum numbers, couplings, and momenta. It is really a container, owner of all the cited objects. In particular, deleting the ModelData will automatically delete the lagrangian, gauge, flavor. Particles are under shared ownership, so will be deleted only if there is no other reference to it in the program. Beware however than even particles cannot be used if the model is deleted as they will refer to a non-existing gauge / flavor.
ModelData instances (together with ModelBuilder and Model) should live at least as longer as any object that come from it, in particular particles, or expressions containing particles. To avoid any problem, define it as a static variable in the main function, or as a dynamically allocated variable deleted at the end of the main function.
ModelBuilder, Model
